Now until the new year, get an additional 20% off the full collection of instruction videos! Additional to the original 25% off.  Use code GIVING Link in my bio. Happy holidays!
Happy holidays! Each one is 4x4 inches and $950. DM if interested or better yet email me  alyssa@alyssamonks.com 👈

My dear, sweet brother Mike passed away Thursday. He was diagnosed with glioblastoma April 9, 2021. We played, so many times, Bad Kingdom by May the Muse. "This is not what you wanted". We played so many songs. We shared everything. I walked with him all the way.. I painted this painting and others. Then I stopped painting and just took his hand. It's been a surreal, painful and often beautiful but always meaningful road together these past 20 months. There's nothing to say yet. My heart doesn't yet believe he's gone. My brother. My best friend. My Mike. My heart.
I revisited this piece from 2021 for a very kind and patient collector. (Study of) It's All Under Control. 16x16in. Thank you for bringing me back to the studio.
Stay Focused. 36x36 in. Oil on linen. 2023. A new piece for my solo exhibition this summer at @mmfineartgallery opening Jluly in Southampton, NY

Spring is finally coming and I'm working away on new work... So here's a gift from me to you. 50% off any print. Use code "Spring". Go to alyssamonks.com/prints or find the link in my bio. Happy Spring. Now for a very limited time. And if there is a painting not on the prints page just email me alyssa@alyssamonks.com

March 16 – April 22, 2023
@forumgallery announces “The Figure in Black and White,” an exhibition of expressive figurative paintings, works on paper and textiles in grayscale by more than thirty artists from Modernist to Contemporary.

Artists featured include:
Steven Assael, William Bailey, Robert Bauer, William Beckman, Kent Bellows, Claudio Bravo, Willem de Kooning, Alan Feltus, Lucian Freud, Gregory Gillespie, John Graham, Susan Hauptman, Joseph Hirsch, Fernand Leger, Michael Leonard, David Levine, Alan Magee, Craig McPherson, Anthony Mitri, Alyssa Monks, Guillermo Muñoz Vera, Clio Newton, Jules Pascin, Mark Podwal, Wade Schuman, Raphael Soyer, Michael C. Thorpe, Maria Tomasula, Oleg Vassiliev, and Charles White.

Image details:
Alyssa Monks, “Self Portrait in Charcoal,” 2017, charcoal on paper, 12 x 10 inches

Always so great to see so many @newyorkacademyofart alumni out and see their work in one room!

Hartley Invitational
On view at Salmagundi
47 5th Ave, NYC
March 6-April 1
M-F 1-6pm
Say-Sun 1-5pm

"We are thrilled to present this year's Hartley
Invitational, which represents some of the finest and most innovative work in contemporary representational art," said Jacob Collins, Salmagundi's President. "The artists in this exhibition demonstrate a remarkable range of skill, vision, and technique, and we are proud to celebrate their achievements."
'The and Annual Hartley Invitational is free and open to the public.
Salmagundi wishes to express appreciation and gratitude to Lisa Lebofsky from the Alumni Association of the New York Academy of Art for acquainting us with several remarkable realist painters emerging from that institution.

@tamalinsoleil @zane.york @shaunafinnart @erik_koeppel_art @jamesxavierbarbour @kristygordonart @alyssamonks @buketsavci @manu.saluja
@patriciawatwood @richardtscott @noah.buchanan @stephaniedesh

In person workshop in NYC at  @newyorkacademyofart registration open! Link in bio or go to academyeverywhere.com

Maybe if I Try Harder. 
54x54 inches. Oil on linen. 2023.

Attune. 66x56 inches. Oil on linen. 2022. On view this weekend with @forumgallery  @ EXPO Chicago 2023 held at the Navy Pier from April 13 to 16.
I painted this last year after moving out of the city to be close to my brother during his fight with glioblastoma. The trees are from my backyard here. This was during a brief rest between his second resection and the tumor regrowing for the third and final time. This time was a deepening of our already special and effortless connection. We shared each other's interests and values and celebrated each other's success and felt each other's heart aches. We were each other's biggest fans and cheered each other on incessantly. We laughed so much. He was simply the best brother and friend and I can't believe how lucky I was to have him. Being this close to someone makes you feel like your heart and mind and nerves are all inside out and a impossibly chaotic mess when you lose them, but it's an experience of love that may be the entire point of all this living.  We really had the best time. Attuned.
On view now at the Chicago art fair with @forumgallery thanks so much.

Workshop May 17 to 19 @newyorkacademyofart Taught by Alyssa Monks, this 3-day in-person workshop is designed to guide the student towards creating a painting from a photo reference using both indirect and direct traditional painting techniques. It aims to instruct painters on how to use the photograph to create a painting that surpasses the look of the photograph, rather than simply imitating it.

The workshop will explain how to create a useful photo reference; covering topics such as ideal lighting, camera settings, lenses, Photoshop, and printing. Students will learn to create color relationships that portray space and volume, and create illusion. Emphasis is then placed on paint application and ways of activating the surface. By focusing on deliberate brush strokes and maintaining accurate color relationships rather than rendering the application of paint describes the form. We will accentuate the structural volumes of the form over the contour, concentrating on relating all parts of the picture to each other with an organized palette. From there, students will be guided towards deciding what information is useful to look for and what usual pitfalls to avoid when interpreting a photograph. Deciding when and how to invent and experiment is perhaps the most crucial part of the process. Students will be encouraged to look more at the painting itself than at the photographic source, using it only for initial reference. We will explore ways of seeing the picture objectively, how to imply detail without overstating, and what level of finish works best for the particular painting or style. The painting will develop through indirect layers of opaque and transparent painting to achieve the delicate nuances of flesh and other surfaces. Methods of glazing and scumbling will be discussed. The final result can be a painting that captures the essence of your subject (and your connection with that subject) and contains the intimacy of the human touch that transcends a smooth photo-realistic image. There are a variety of results varying from abstraction/improvisation to a more illusionistic representation. All will be discussed and the challenges and rewards of each will be

Workshop May 17 to 19 @newyorkacademyofart "Transcending the Photo Reference" a few spots left! Discount for NYAA students and alumni. Small class. Register with link in bio!

In person workshop: Transcending the Photo Reference @newyorkacademyofart May 17 to 19. A few spots left. Very small class! Sign up in the link in bio.

Learn to make a beautiful and useful photo reference, print it, and then translate it in a satisfying and unique way into paint. Find your unique stroke, handwriting, and style. Demonstrations, lectures, notes, and one on one guidance. You'll walk away with inspiring instruction to take with you and make your own in your studio.
Some of the paintings I made of my mom over the years. Happy mother's day to all the mothers. 💜

Show opens July 8th @mmfineartgallery
There is only one of you in all of time. Keep the channels open.

West Coast Workshop in beautiful San Luis Obispo @willowpondSLO September 8 to 11. We will be Transcending the Photo Reference in Paint. There is no other workshop that discusses how to use a photo reference correctly and effectively, yet so many painters are doing it! Join me for a 4 day workshop packed with lectures, Demonstrations, one on one guidance, and many tips, answers to your questions, and some fun as well. More info at willowpondSLO.com register soon! Limited space of 12 students. Looking forward to this! (Thanks to @wafa_raj  for the reel)

16 Paintings in a Solo Exhibition at @mmfineartgallery entitled WHERE LONGING MEETS LIMITS opens July 8 to July 23. Gallery talk with @fischlstudio July 23rd at 3pm. 
Alyssa Monks's new exhibition of paintings, entitled "Where Longing
Meets Limits," confronts the human experience of longing for that
which is beyond our reach. The recent loss of her brother weighs heavy
as does the wanting things to be different than they are. Unbridled
human vulnerability arises from the helpless awareness of being unable
to control so much of what we try to. Not limited to mortality, this
permeates almost everything human beings pursue. Flowers, branches,
water droplets, and vapor - painted carefully in harmonizing color - speak to the ideals of femininity and beauty distort and overwhelm the
portraits, creating an illusive expression that is impossible to see
fully and interpret. We are left knitting bits of delicate
illusionistic form together to catch a glimpse of these women,
ensconced in their distancing efforts to control what you see, but
also begging to be seen. We are in an endless loop, and only find
ourselves in the end, also trying to make sense of a senseless
experience, realizing that it is ultimately a futile pursuit. Monks's
aim is to inspire viewers to let go before they must let go, in order
to fully experience the surprisingly beautiful unpredictability of
life.

When Longing Meets Limits. 70x96 inches. Oil on linen. 2023. On view @mmfineartgallery beginning July 8. I'm so looking forward to the show at @mmfineartgallery July 8! 16 Paintings on view and I get to discuss them with @fischlstudio ☺️

OPENING TODAY
"At First Blush"
June 29 - September 23, 2023

Forum Gallery presents "At First Blush," an exhibition of paintings and drawings, each of which is more than it first seems. These provocative works invite the viewer to create his own story and frame of reference for the subject the artist depicts. Something is happening, has just happened or is anticipated in every work, but that something is not explicit, it is up to us to define. Artists include Philip Pearlstein, Raphael Soyer, William Beckman, @stevenassael, Alan Feltus, Paul Fenniak, Guillermo Munoz Vera, Richard Maury, and Gregory Gillespie. 

"At First Blush" will be on view from June 29 to September 23, 2023. Forum Gallery is open Monday through Friday, 10 AM to 5:30 PM, and closed Saturday and Sunday during June, July and August.

Image Details: 
Alyssa Monks, "Be Perfectly Still", 2021, oil on linen, 47 x 33 inches

So excited for my California Workshop @willowpondslo  September 8 to 11. Must register by August 11!!! Space is very limited for a personal experience. I'll show you all my techniques and tools for creating a vibrant and illusionistic painting from a reference photograph, beyond just copying or imitation. You'll feel your hand and gesture in the paint, creating something unique and expressive as well as realistic. I hope you can make it to beautiful SLO! Link in my bio or at WillowPondSLO.com

I'm so proud and excited for my Alma Mater @newyorkacademyofart and their new catalog of self-paced Online Classes! Check out what they have for you at the highest quality from their own stellar faculty including @jeanpierreroy @manu.saluja @sweetmarshalljones
 @gunopark @aidanbarkerhill nbarkerhill @zane.york  Go to NYAA.edu and click on "Academy Everywhere" at the top right for a ton of resources, some resources are Free! Enjoy ⭐

Goodbye. 24x34. Oil on linen. I made this because grief is, at the very least, disorienting. When someone so much a part of you passes away, your whole sense of reality is challenged moment to moment until you reorganize everything you know and Believe and value and enjoy and desire to become a new you in a new reality.
I saw this display on my street the light morning. Morning mist losing is battle with the Sun rise. 4x4 inches. Oil on panel.

Bid Online before Monday! Click the Link in my bio! @newyorkacademyofart annual auction fund raiser at @sothebys is Monday. I've donated this piece, Be Perfectly Still to support the finest and most valuable arts education institution, the NEW YORK ACADEMY OF ART, in my humble opinion. I suppose I have this opinion because this school has done more for me in my life and career over the last 24 years than I can express. This community is growing constantly and there are so many ways to be a part of it as well. Check it out! And if you can, bid on my painting to help support such a positive resource for artists and art lovers alike. Come to the auction! It's the most fun event of the year and you'll definitely be rubbing elbows with some of the greatest artists alive. See you there! Tickets at NYAA.edu

What a fabulous night at the @newyorkacademyofart #takehomeanude auction last night! So much joy and elation in this beautiful community! I'm so lucky to know these wonderful people. @lisa_lebofsky @alumniassociationnyaa @michellelynndoll @carriebracco_art @melanievote @bernardosiciliano @jaclynbrown83 @katejavens @maggierosestudio @paintermatty @newyorkacademyofart @davidckratz @hope.cotter

Holiday Print Sale is here! New Prints Added. Use code "Give" for 25% off ALL prints at AlyssaMonks.com/prints 🎁 international shipping $25

As the years go by, it seems the cultural message of never enough is getting louder and harder to ignore. We are not smart enough, hot enough, earning enough, selling enough, learning enough, Zen enough, evolved enough, sexy enough, popular enough, wealthy enough, healthy enough, creative enough, important enough, respected enough, attractive enough, young enough, strong enough, loved enough, going fast enough, getting enough, successful enough, happy enough. And I imagine as the holidays are upon us now the message will get even louder as we are marketed to to buy more and things, do more things, have more things and just be more. I hope that in the midst of it all we can get a little clarity and peace and maybe feel that what we have right now is actually more than enough, and relax in gratitude for a few moments enjoying a feeling of want-free revelling in that which we have already created, earned, achieved, been and done and in the people we love...while it all and they are all still here... And know that the path to real happiness is loving what you have, and getting more is often  feeding a hungry ghost. My best wishes for a Meaningful and Healthy Thanksgiving, Friends. It's actually enough. ❤️
let go

My friends and I are having a group show of small landscapes in NYC made from our travels together and separately! Opening this Thursday at DFN projects

Garvey|Simon is proud to present Explorations, featuring artists Lisa Lebofsky @lisa_lebofsky), Michelle Doll (@michellelynndoll), Alyssa Monks (@alyssamonks), Carrie-Ann Bracco (@carriebracco_art), and Melanie Vote (@melanievote).
With a history of traveling the globe together these 5 artists bring a collection of paintings crafted beyond the familiar confines of their studio spaces.

There will be an opening reception for the artists on Thursday, November 30 at DFN Projects, 16 East 79th Street, Garden Level, New York, from 5-7pm. 
Regular Gallery hours are Monday - Friday, 11-4pm.

Link in my bio for my entire collection of online classes at 50% off! Explore how to think about and mix color to create volume and space, how to start a painting with an imprimatura, how to think about composition, how to take a great reference photo, how to heal burnout, find FLOW and turn your inner critic into an inner mentor. Learn and mediums, glazing, scumbling, and more. Plus interviews with Bo Bartlett, Betsy Eby, Lisa Lebofsky, and Chris Wilson. Now for a very limited time! Happy New Year! Happy to announce my exhibition with the amazing @clionewton opening Jan 18  @forumgallery 
My new paintings in this exhibition confront the human experience of longing for that which is beyond our reach. Unbridled human vulnerability arises from the helpless awareness of being unable to control so much of what we try to. Flowers, branches, water droplets, and vapor - painted carefully in harmonizing color - speak to the ideals of femininity and beauty but also distort and overwhelm the portraits creating an elusive expression that is impossible to see fully and interpret. We are left knitting bits of delicate illusionistic form together to catch a glimpse of these women, ensconced in their distancing efforts to control what you see, but also begging to be seen. We are in an endless loop, and only find ourselves in the end, also trying to make sense of a senseless experience, realizing that it is ultimately a futile pursuit. My aim is to inspire viewers to let go before they must let go in order to fully experience the surprisingly beautiful unpredictability of life.
Metamorphosis. 48x66 inches. Oil in linen. 2024. On view starting next week Jan 18th @forumgallery until March 2 in a two woman show with @clionewton
Painter
